item.title: PSA: Borderlands 4â€™s Most Useful Change Isn't Mentioned in the Patch Notes
item.description:
Borderlands 4 fans have noticed a huge quality-of-life change to the Lost Loot Machine that makes it much easier to use, despite there being no sign of it in the most recent patch notes. Now, Borderlands 4 players can sell items directly from the Lost Loot Machine, which should save tons of time in the long run.

Previously, the Lost Loot Machine in Borderlands 4 required players to retrieve each item and mark them as junk directly in their inventory. In practice, this could become quite time-consuming, especially for players with already packed inventories. And because cash is so easy to find in Borderlands 4 's late game, for many players, it simply stopped being worth visiting the Lost Loot Machine altogether.

Borderlands 4 Players Can Now Sell Loot Directly From the Lost Loot Machine

However, players have noticed that following the most recent Borderlands 4 update, the Lost Loot Machine has become much more usable. Post-patch, players can now sell items directly from the Lost Loot Machine, both individually and in bulk. This removes several layers of frustration, and speeds up the process of getting rid of these items altogether. Users in the Reddit thread started by nknasi welcomed the change, with one player saying that previously, "doing anything but trashing was so cumbersome."

Curiously, there appears to be no mention of this Borderlands 4 quality-of-life change in the recent patch notes, so Gearbox appears to have quietly slipped this into the update. The Lost Loot Machine did receive a few other notable changes in the October 23 patch, including that it will now "better prioritize higher-quality loot in overflow situations." So not only can players sell their loot more easily, but it should also be of better quality.

It's great to see Gearbox honing in on these smaller changes that add up to a much better Borderlands 4 experience. In the coming months, gamers will start to see the release of more significant Borderlands 4 content, but in the meantime, the developer can continue refining what is already an excellent Borderlands title.

34
8.4 /10
8 /10

Borderlands 4

item.title: Upcoming Xbox Series X Games For 2025 & Beyond
item.description:
At this point, the Xbox Series X/S is a known commodity that has a pretty respectable library of games, covering both major AAA projects and indie darlings. Microsoft opted for a dual-tier system for this generation, offering the high-end Xbox Series X alongside the more budget-friendly Xbox Series S, with the latter being digital-only.

Game Pass has continued to flourish over the last few years, with any Xbox console exclusives typically debuting directly on the subscription service. The last few years have produced plenty of fantastic games, particularly in the open-world genre. What upcoming 2025 Xbox games are the most exciting? Which titles will come out in the remainder of 2025?

Please note that the focus is on the North American release dates of Xbox Series X/S and Xbox One games . Expansions will also be listed. That said, this lineup is not exhaustive, as the focus is on major games.

Updated October 26, 2025, by Mark Sammut: The upcoming Xbox Series X games have been added to the calendar: Science Skaters, Chicken Run: Eggstraction, Flying Aces: Legend of the Red Baron, Surviving Mars: Relaunched, Sacred 2: Fallen Angel Remaster, Marvel Cosmic Invasion, Avatar Legends: The Fighting Game, Dumb Ways to Party, Bluey's Quest for the Gold Pen, Halo: Campaign Evolved, Beneath, Card Collector Trading Shop, Strike Force 3, Zumba - Marble Zombie Invasion, Dungeon Minesweeper, 1000xRESIST, Another Bar Game, My Life: Farm Vet, Voidtrain, Build a Bridge!, Peachy Derby, House Fighters: Total Mess, Windswept, Legends BMX, Videoverse (XBX/S, JDM: Japanese Drift Master, A.I.L.A, Schildmaid MX, Sleep Awake, Avatar: Frontiers of Pandora - From the Ashes Edition, Horror Tale 1: 4k Remaster, Cthulhu: The Cosmic Abyss.

Xbox Games Coming Out In October 2025

Battlefield, Ninja Gaiden 4, Outer Worlds 2, Little Nightmares 3, & More

October 2025 has been one of 2025's biggest months for gaming, particularly for Xbox. Every week includes at least a couple of major releases, and they cover a pretty impressive range of genres. JRPG fans will want to check out Digimon Story: Time Stranger or the HD-2D remakes of the first two Dragon Quest games. If you are into shooters, Painkiller should be a blast, and The Outer Worlds 2 is also one of the month's biggest releases.

Personally, Ninja Gaiden 4 was my most anticipated Xbox game of 2025, and PlatinumGames' sequel was pretty awesome. On the same day, Jurassic World Evolution 3 also debuted. Little Nightmares 3 and Arc Raiders are also big deals. Finally, EA's Battlefield 6 is the month's biggest game.

Xbox Games Coming Out In November 2025

COD Black Ops 7, Farming Simulator, Anno, SpongeBob, & More

November 2025 only needs one Xbox game to be among the year's biggest: Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 . For some people, Activision's upcoming multiplayer shooter is the only game that matters, and they will push it to the top of the year's best-selling projects. For others, COD is just not something that attracts their interest anymore, even though the upcoming release will be on Game Pass.

If you are not interested in BO7 , you might want to keep an eye on Anno 117 , Unbeatable , Outlaws , and Project Motor Racing . These games cover a pretty wide range of genres, so they should be able to keep most people busy. 3D platformer fans can pick up SpongeBob SquarePants: Titans of the Tide . Football Manager 26 should finally be coming out, with the game debuting on November 4 and coming immediately to Game Pass.

Xbox Games Coming Out In December 2025

Octopath Traveler, Destiny 2, & More

Historically, December has not been great for new releases. The second half of the month often has no major games, while the first half tends to be pretty underwhelming compared to November. Still, the upcoming edition has a few exciting Xbox Series games, including Octopath Traveler 0 . Meanwhile, Destiny 2 will be releasing its next expansion, "Renegades."

Major Upcoming Xbox Games Coming In 2026 & Beyond

GTA 6, Elder Scrolls, & More

2026 is still a few months away, but the first quarter is starting to really take shape. This is hardly surprising as plenty of publishers try to get in their last major releases before the end of the fiscal year, so February and March tend to be extremely active. When it comes to upcoming 2026 Xbox games , there are quite a few third-party projects that will get the year started on the right note. Soulslike fans will want to check out Code Vein 2 , which has a solid, if janky foundation to build upon. Final Fantasy 7 Remake Intergrade is also finally coming to the Xbox Series in January 2026.

Things will really get going in February 2026, with Deus Ex Remastered, Dragon Quest VII Reimagined , and Yakuza Kiwami 3 & Dark Ties all being huge remasters/remakes. For new games, High On Life 2 should be a decent shooter, and the month ends with probably the biggest horror game of the year, Resident Evil Requiem â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹.

March 2026 is almost as active as February, with Crimson Desert and 007 First Light both looking great. Then, in May 2026, GTA 6 comes out.

item.title: Best Blade Build in Marvel Rivals Zombies Mode
item.description:
Surviving the undead hordes in Zombies Halloween event for Marvel Rivals gets quite tricky once players beat Normal difficulty, and that's especially true for someone like Blade. Playing as a melee fighter in a mode where players are very likely to get instantly killed is no walk in the park, but with this build, even Zombies Nightmare 4 in Marvel Rivals is going to feel easy.

Best Blade Build for Zombies in Marvel Rivals

This build focuses on one thing: Blade's auto attack . When you toggle his Bloodline Awakening skill, Blade's sword slashes become faster, and you gain Lifesteal while the skill is active. This comes at the cost of reduced healing effectiveness, but this hardly matters in Zombies compared to how it usually would when playing Blade in Marvel Rivals .

Spend all of your passive points on red skills before starting a match, and when you do start a game, focus on getting the following blessings:

Blessing

Type/Color

Effect

On The Hunt

Red

Increase Ancestral Sword Damage

Swift Edge

Red

Increase Ancestral Sword Attack Speed

Sweeping Edge

Red

Increase Ancestral Sword Range

Crimson Will

Red

Increase Lifesteal ratio when Bloodline Awakening is active

Blade Dance

Red

Enhance Daywalker Dash; hitting enemies triggers Spinning Slash.

Vitality Boost

Purple

Increase health

Power Surge

Purple

Increase damage

Vampiric Vitality

Purple

Convert a percentage of damage dealt to health

Ability choices don't matter here, so just stick to the default ones or pick whatever you prefer.

When picking a blessing, prioritize them according to this list:

  1. On The Hunt
  2. Sweeping Edge
  3. Power Surge
  4. Swift Edge
  5. Vitality Boost
  6. Crimson Will
  7. Vampiric Vitality
  8. Blade Dance

In summary, this build greatly extends Blade's melee attack reach , turning it into a pseudo-ranged attack. This is important for two reasons: it lets you take out exploding zombies safely from a distance, and it lets you damage both Queen of the Dead (Scarlet Witch) bosses on Nightmare 4 difficulty simultaneously. The build works well in both solo and co-op, and it's great if you want to get Units, titles, and other rewards from this Halloween event.

Get as much damage and range blessings as possible , and grab attack speed until you're satisfied. Only get Vitality Boost when you get the +100 or +450 health version, and take at least one of each of the Lifesteal blessings (Crimson Will and Vampiric Vitality). Above all, try to reach 120 red blessing points ASAP. Your DPS will skyrocket once you reach that point.

We take Blade Dance despite it being a Daywalker Dash skill simply because of how strong it is (and also because it's fun to use). You'll be spending the majority of your time just holding down your primary fire button while running circles around the Avengers Tower courtyard.

Marvel Rivals
9 /10
109
8.9 /10

December 6, 2024

item.title: Diablo 4 Players Aren't Happy With the Upcoming Season 11 Masterworking Changes
item.description:
Diablo 4 players are voicing their frustrations at the new Masterworking changes coming in Season 11. Some Diablo 4 players have already had the chance to try out Masterworking in the ongoing PTR, and many aren't happy with their experience.

Diablo 4 's Masterworking changes were first teased earlier this month, as a way to refresh one of the game's crafting systems. It was unclear exactly what form this would take, until the 2.5.0 PTR revealed that players would now have to click their way through 20 ranks of upgrades to Masterwork their items. Only after progressing through these 20 ranks could players randomly upgrade one of the additional affixes on their item, which could also be re-rolled using a new crafting material called Neathiron. This reduced the overall effectiveness of Masterworking, and added a lot more clicking in the process.

Diablo 4's Masterworking Changes in Season 11 PTR Aren't Going Down Well With Fans

Fans have been quick to share their thoughts on the Diablo 4 2.5.0 PTR, specifically the Masterworking changes. One online thread by user Nyksiko described the system as a "disaster," calling it "a boring chore you need in order to get that last GA lottery." Others claim it's a "boring alternative" to the current Masterworking system, which, while still featuring some RNG elements, still has "something interesting every 4 levels to see which affix your gamble hits."

Another Redditor named aspectofderp started a thread claiming that Diablo 4 's Masterworking should be removed if it stays on this course, comparing it to "upgrading your potion every season. We do it but it is a formality and adds literally NOTHING to the game." Although the sentiment surrounding the upcoming Masterworking changes are pretty negative right now, it's worth noting that Blizzard still has time to make adjustments before Season 11 goes live in December. Hopefully, the feedback will be taken on board and acted upon, to reach a system players are much happier with in Season 11.

Diablo 4 Season 11 is expected to begin on December 9, after Season 10 concludes. However, rumors currently suggest that players might have even more to look forward to, with some suggestion that Diablo 4 's second expansion could be revealed in December. Of course, this should be taken with a pinch of salt, but it's certainly an exciting prospect to consider, given the long wait since Vessel of Hatred .

116
7.5 /10
9 /10

item.title: Pokemon Legends: Z-A - 8 Most Mind-Blowing Revelations Related To Pokemon X And Y
item.description:
It may not be immediately evident based on its title, but Pokemon Legends: Z-A is actually a sequel to Pokemon X and Y , a special distinction that it shares with very few other mainline Pokemon entries (like Black 2 and White 2 ). This recently-released title takes place five years after the events of Generation Sixâ€™s debut and, as a result, it features appearances by many of its most iconic and beloved characters, who also play an important role in the latest story.

Needless to say, being able to meet up with the likes of Emma, AZ, and many others after so many years is incredibly nostalgicâ€”especially for passionate fans of the Kalos regionâ€”but Pokemon Legends: Z-A is also hiding several shocking and intriguing twists that are related to Pokemon X and Y â€™s classic plot. From the whereabouts of other characters to the secrets hiding within Lumiose City, here are the most mind-blowing facts about the Kalos region that revealed in Pokemon Legends: Z-A .

AZ Is Back

This 3000-Year-Old Legend Is Now Running His Own Hotel

AZ is definitely one of Pokemon X and Y â€™s most fascinating characters. After all, heâ€™s a 3000-year-old immortal who used to be the King of Kalos and is directly responsible for the creation of the Ultimate Weapon that Lysandre tried (and failed) to use during that gameâ€™s climax. Furthermore, every Pokemon fan remembers the heartbreaking final scene in which AZ finally reunites with his Eternal Flower Floette.

Pokemon Legends: Z-A not only reveals that AZ is still alive, but he also plays an important role in the story. Heâ€™s the owner of Hotel Z, where he lives with his Floette, and is basically Team MZâ€™s mentor. Seeing AZ living a peaceful life after all he went through in X and Y is very satisfying, but it's slowly made clear that heâ€™s still hiding many dark secrets and that he may have one final part to play in Legends: Z-A's intriguing narrative.

The New Pokemon Professor

Sycamore Was Replaced By Mable, Of Team Flare Fame

Augustine Sycamore is the Kalos regionâ€™s designated Pokemon Professor. He conducts research on Mega Evolution and gifts one of the Kanto starters to the player in Pokemon X and Y . Since his laboratory was located in Lumiose City, some players may feel enticed to pay him a visit, but they'll immediately find out that somebody new has taken his place.

Thatâ€™s right: Mable , one of Team Flareâ€™s former scientists, has replaced Sycamore as the director of the Pokemon Research Lab. She even mentions that she agreed to take the position as part of a plea deal to avoid going to prison after the events of X and Y . As for Sycamore, heâ€™s nowhere to be found throughout the campaign of Legends: Z-A , but some photos of him can be found hanging in the lab. Additionally, an NPC mentions that Sycamore and Trevor (one of the previous game's rivals) are doing research together in another region.

Emma Has Grown Up And Is Following In Lookerâ€™s Footsteps

Sheâ€™s The New Lead Detective Of Looker Bureau

Some Pokemon X and Y players may not have been aware of Emma â€™s existence, as sheâ€™s the star of a side quest that can be easily missed. She was an orphan living in Lumiose Cityâ€™s alleyways who was manipulated by Team Flareâ€™s Xerosic and, with some help from the player, was saved by Looker, who basically adopted her and allowed her to live with him at Looker Bureau.

Pokemon Legends: Z-A takes place five years after the events of X and Y , meaning that Emma is twenty-one years old now. On top of that, she has become a fully-fledged detective and has turned Looker Bureau into her own office, which is really nice to see after everything she went through in the last game. Looker himself is completely absent from Legends: Z-A (although Emma has a picture of him on her desk) but seasoned Pokemon fans are fully aware of the fact that he has made his way to the Alola region, where heâ€™s working alongside Anabel.

Lysandre Is Alive

The Main Villain Of Pokemon X And Y Has Taken On A New Identity

Some Pokemon antagonists are extremely memorable, and others are very forgettable.,Uunfortunately, Lysandre, from Pokemon X and Y, belonged to the latter group for many years. While he does have a striking design, his motivations, actions, and personality were very generic, especially in comparison to other villains in the series. The only thing most players remember about him is the fact that he was seemingly killed by the Ultimate Weapon he tried to fire off during X and Y â€™s climax.

However, at one point in Legends: Z-A , the player meets a mysterious man who has no recollection of who he really is, so he simply goes by L . Thatâ€™s right, this is an amnesiac Lysandre, and the game later reveals that he survived the events of X and Y after being rescued by Zygarde. Now, heâ€™s dedicating his life to helping the heroic legendary Pokemon. Lysandreâ€™s redemption arc is extremely unexpected, but it is also executed very well, and it adds some much-needed depth to this once-forgettable Pokemon villain.

Team Flare Still Exists

The Sudden Rise Of Team Flare Nouveau

Similar to its leader, Lysandre, Team Flare has always been regarded as one of the least interesting evil teams in the history of the Pokemon franchise. Fortunately, Pokemon Legends: Z-A reveals a lot of fascinating information about this organization, including its origins, its influence, and even the whereabouts of some of its members.

Team Flare was originally supposed to be a place for people to help the less fortunate and many lives were improved by their actions (like Corbeauâ€™s) until Lysandreâ€™s delusions about Xerneas, Yveltal, and the Ultimate Weapon led them down the wrong path. Shortly after the events of X and Y , Grisham, Griselle and a bunch of young officers created Team Flare Nouveau , a secret new branch of the organization that is trying to carry on its original purpose while also trying to fix its soured reputation. Despite their aggressive personality, the members of Team Flare Nouveau are not evil, and they even help the player on a few occasions, which is definitely an interesting and creative direction to take this plot thread.

Clemont And Bonnie Left Prism Tower

Lumiose Cityâ€™s Resident Gym Leader Was Forced To Leave His Gym

Clemont is the Electric-type Gym Leader of Lumiose City, and his gym is located at the top of the city's main attraction, Prism Tower. However, most fans likely remember him and his little sister, Bonnie , due to their role as two of Ash Ketchumâ€™s companions in Pokemon the Series: XY . When it was revealed that Pokemon Legends: Z-A would take place entirely within Lumiose City, fans naturally assumed that Clemont and Bonnie would make an appearance in the game. Sadly, this never came to fruition.

Between X and Y and Legends: Z-A , Quasartico Inc. closed Prism Tower to renovate it, so Clemont and Bonnie had to leave their home behind. An NPC mentions the brilliant inventor and his sister, both of whom used to hold quizzes and Pokemon Battles inside the tower, so at least they are still fondly remembered by the residents of Lumiose City. Hopefully, both Clemont and Bonnie will appear in the upcoming Mega Dimension DLC.

Diantha Is Focusing On Her Acting Career

The Champion Doesnâ€™t Seem To Care About Battles Anymore

In Pokemon Legends: Z-A , AZ and the members of Team MZ are looking for the Strongest Mega Evolution trainer who can theoretically stop the mysterious force that resides within Prism Tower. While this role is obviously supposed to fall on the main character, many fans canâ€™t help but wonder: what about Diantha ? After all, the Kalos regionâ€™s Champion is a powerful trainer with a Mega Gardevoir in her team, so itâ€™s strange that she didnâ€™t pop up to help Lumiose City during its latest crisis.

Itâ€™s important to remember that Diantha is not only a Pokemon Champion, but also a world-renowned actress. Various posters advertising her latest movie can be found throughout the city, and an NPC even mentions that sheâ€™s now focusing on her movie career, so the most reasonable explanation for her absence is that sheâ€™s so busy that she canâ€™t focus on her duties as Champion anymore. Nevertheless, she is still a popular character whose absence is slightly disappointing, so hopefully she can appear again in either a future Pokemon game and/or in the upcoming DLC expansion for Legends: Z-A .

Thereâ€™s Another Ancient Weapon Inside Prism Tower

The Ultimate Weapon Wasnâ€™t Enough For AZ, So He Created Ange

Even though Prism Tower is Lumiose Cityâ€™s biggest and most iconic landmark, it is completely inaccessible to players, not only because Quasartico Inc. closed it for renovations but also because something inside of it is scattering Mega Power and causing wild Pokemon throughout the city to suddenly Mega Evolve. Luckily, the truth is finally revealed to the player in the final act of Legends: Z-A : Two thousand years in the past, AZ created yet another ancient weapon called Ange and placed it within Prism Tower.

Ange is the star of one of the most over-the-top, memorable, and exciting final boss fights in the history of the Pokemon franchise. The main character has to join forces with Zygarde, Taunie/Urban, and Eternal Flower Floette to fight this massive machine-monster hybrid and put an end to its destructive rampage. Due to Angeâ€™s existence, Prism Tower itself plays a huge role in the story of Legends: Z-A , which is pretty mind-blowing to think about. Sadly, AZ passes away shortly after Ange is defeated, making it one of the few times a human character in a Pokemon entry dies during the story, not to mention that the player visits his gravestone after the credits.

65
5.0 /10
